meanings.definition: To send or direct (something) by an incorrect route or to the wrong destination.
meanings.sent1: She kept misrouting the emails to the spam folder.
meanings.sent2: The delivery driver misrouted the package to the neighboring house.
meanings.sent3: The misrouting of the package led to a comical mix-up with the neighbor.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts misrouted like a tangled maze, unable to find the right path.
meanings.sent5: The misrouting of the train caused chaos on the tracks.

meanings.definition: The act of sending or directing something by an incorrect route or to the wrong destination.
meanings.sent1: The misrouting of the letter delayed its delivery.
meanings.sent2: He discovered the misrouting of the funds during the audit.
meanings.sent3: The misrouting of the tourists resulted in a funny sightseeing adventure.
meanings.sent4: The misrouting of emotions can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The misrouting of the bus caused confusion among the passengers.
